what is a panda?: A panda, also known as a giant panda, is a species of bear native to China. They are easily recognized by their distinctive black and white markings, with black fur around their eyes, ears, and legs, and white fur on the rest of their body. Pandas primarily eat bamboo, but they will also eat fruits, vegetables, and occasionally small animals. They are an endangered species with a population of approximately 1,800 in the wild. Pandas are also beloved by many people around the world for their cute and cuddly appearance.
